name: Achari Gobi (pickled cauliflower with garbanzo beans and bell peppers)
description: Achari Gobi (pickled cauliflower with garbanzo beans and bell peppers). A delicious, easy and healthy meal great for weeknights. Vegan and Gluten Free Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup canned garbanzo beans ((drained and washed))
1/2 teaspoon chili flakes or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Coarsely blend/grind the fennel, cumin, mustard, fenugreek and nigella seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Coarsely blend/grind the fennel, cumin, mustard, fenugreek and nigella seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, dry roast the blended spices on medium heat for a minute. You can dry roast the whole spices and grind and keep as well. For a more punjabi achari taste, add a bit more fennel and nigella seeds. Southern Indian Pickles use more of mustard and fenugreek seeds, so you can try adjust the spices according to taste!
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, dry roast the blended spices on medium heat for a minute. You can dry roast the whole spices and grind and keep as well. For a more punjabi achari taste, add a bit more fennel and nigella seeds. Southern Indian Pickles use more of mustard and fenugreek seeds, so you can try adjust the spices according to taste!

recipeInstructions.text: Add the oil to the pan with spices and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the oil to the pan with spices and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the turmeric and chili flakes and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the turmeric and chili flakes and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped garlic and cook for a minute. (Garlic is optional)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped garlic and cook for a minute. (Garlic is optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the cauliflower, garbanzo beans and green bell pepper and salt and mix well to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the cauliflower, garbanzo beans and green bell pepper and salt and mix well to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes stirring occasionally but lightly to avoid breaking the florets. Cook covered for 15 minutes and then partially covered for the next 10.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes stirring occasionally but lightly to avoid breaking the florets. Cook covered for 15 minutes and then partially covered for the next 10.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot, sprinkled with lemon juice and topped with chopped cilantro ! with some hot Roti/Chapati, Daal (lentil curry) and salad!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot, sprinkled with lemon juice and topped with chopped cilantro ! with some hot Roti/Chapati, Daal (lentil curry) and salad!

keywords: cauliflower main dish, easy indian recipe, healthy main course
